main event: An unidentified aerial object was observed on July 8, 1954, at Fairchild Air Force Base in Washington. The object was silvery in color, stationary for about 45 minutes, estimated to be 50-60 feet in diameter, and had a saucer-like shape before finally moving away.
interesting points: The sighting was confirmed by multiple sources, including civilian pilot and military aircraft reports, all estimating the object's altitude to be around 60,000 feet.
The object was observed through binoculars and was reported to have a definitive saucer-like shape with no exhaust or trail observed.
Despite the object being observed for an extended period and photographs being taken, no object was visible on the negatives upon film development.
The observer was a US Air Force General who filled out a detailed questionnaire providing information about the sighting.

The observer's report mentioned the hazy conditions at the time, no signs of movement similar to a weather balloon, and additional notes about the photographs being taken with binoculars affixed to the camera.
sighted object: unidentified aerial object with a saucer-like shape
witnesses: US Air Force General, civilian pilot, and military aircraft reports
photographs: yes, photographs were taken but no object was visible upon developmen
